thread.title: New OC talks Tennessee's quarterback competition
thread.title_full: New OC talks Tennessee's quarterback competition

title: New OC talks Tennessee's quarterback competition
text:
Slot to Tennessee Links Tennessee offensive coordinator Larry Scott (Photo: Wes Rucker, 247Sports) 
NASHVILLE, Tenn. — Larry Scott made it plain and simple Thursday afternoon when asked about Tennessee’s quarterback situation heading into spring practice. 
The Vols don’t have a starting quarterback, according to their new offensive coordinator. 
“It’s a wide open competition, which is what’s best for us right now moving forward,” Scott said moments after speaking to a large crowd for the Vols’ annual recruiting celebration at the Tennessee Titans’ Nissan Stadium in Downtown Nashville. 
(Want the latest scoop on Tennessee football and basketball? Make sure you're in the loop — take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) 
Tennessee head coach Butch Jones has suggested several times that all four of the Vols’ scholarship quarterbacks — junior Quinten Dormady , sophomore Sheriron Jones , redshirt freshman Jarrett Guarantano and freshman January enrollee Will McBride — will be given a fair chance to earn the spot, and Scott said nothing to the contrary. Tennessee junior quarterback Quinten Dormady (Photo: Icon Sportswire, Getty) 
Scott said all four players are fired up for the opportunity and fired up to work with new quarterbacks coach Mike Canales , because a new position coach means a fresh start for everyone. 
(Buy one month of GoVols247 VIP access and GET TWO MONTHS FREE .) 
“All those guys are excited about it,” said Scott, who served as Tennessee’s tight ends coach last season. “They’re gonna get a chance to work with Coach Canales. It’s gonna be a unique experience, because it’s not [a situation] where those guys are gonna come out and they’ve had a coach there that’s gonna already have a formulated opinion on ‘em. It’s gonna be truly wide open, and he’s gonna be working with them on a daily basis both mentally and physically, him learning them, them learning him and all those types of things. 
“It’s gonna be fascinating to watch it all come together. It’s exciting for young college football players.”
